    15â†’## System Architecture
    16â†’
    17â†’This is a comprehensive agent-based system with **71 agent files in the agents/ directory** (69 specialized agents plus templates/docs) that can autonomously coordinate via Claude Code's Task tool and the advanced Tandem Orchestration System. All agents follow the v7.0 template standard and are optimized for Intel Meteor Lake CPUs with dual-layer Python/C execution capabilities.
    18â†’
    19â†’### Key Features
    20â†’- **Hardware-Aware Execution**: Optimized for Intel Core Ultra 7 155H (Meteor Lake)
    21â†’- **Autonomous Coordination**: Agents invoke each other via Task tool
    22â†’- **Proactive Invocation**: Pattern-based auto-triggering
    23â†’- **Production Ready**: Comprehensive error handling and recovery
    24â†’- **PostgreSQL 16/17 Universal Database**: >2000 auth/sec, <25ms P95 latency, backwards compatible JSON operations
    25â†’- **Enhanced Learning System v3.1**: ML-powered agent performance analytics with schema evolution and drift prevention
    26â†’- **Tandem Orchestration**: Advanced Python-first orchestration system with C integration capability
    27â†’- **Dual-Layer Architecture**: Strategic Python layer + tactical C layer for maximum flexibility
    28â†’- **Command Sets**: High-level workflow abstraction for complex multi-agent coordination
    29â†’- **Global CLAUDE.md**: Comprehensive auto-invocation guide with 15k+ words of agent patterns
    30â†’- **Professional Organization**: Clean directory structure with database/, agents/, docs/, orchestration/
    31â†’- **Counter-Intelligence Integration**: 99.99% surveillance evasion with Five Eyes/NATO defense capabilities
    32â†’- **Cognitive Defense**: 99.94% manipulation detection with deprogramming protocols
    33â†’- **Claude Ultimate Wrapper v13.1**: Automatic agent discovery and registration with enhanced error recovery
    34â†’
    35â†’## Claude Ultimate Wrapper v13.1
    36â†’
    37â†’The `claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh` is an enhanced wrapper that provides:
    38â†’
    39â†’### Features
    40â†’- **Automatic Agent Registration**: Discovers and registers all 71 agents from `agents/` directory
    41â†’- **Intelligent Path Discovery**: Finds agents relative to script location (symlink-aware)
    42â†’- **Agent Metadata Extraction**: Extracts category, description, UUID, tools from agent files
    43â†’- **Status Classification**: Categorizes agents as active/template/stub based on completeness
    44â†’- **JSON Registry Cache**: Maintains cached registry for performance
    45â†’- **Error Recovery**: Automatic yoga.wasm issue detection and recovery
    46â†’- **Virtual Environment Support**: Automatic venv activation if available
    47â†’- **Permission Bypass**: Built-in `--dangerously-skip-permissions` for LiveCD compatibility
    48â†’- **Banner Suppression**: Clean output without verbose headers
    49â†’
    50â†’### Installation
    51â†’```bash
    52â†’# Symlink installation (preserves agent discovery)
    53â†’ln -sf /home/ubuntu/Downloads/claude-backups/claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh /home/ubuntu/.local/bin/claude
    54â†’chmod +x /home/ubuntu/Downloads/claude-backups/claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh
    55â†’```
    56â†’
    57â†’### Commands
    58â†’- `claude --help` - Show comprehensive help
    59â†’- `claude --status` - System status with agent registry info
    60â†’- `claude --agents` or `claude agents` - List all available agents by category
    61â†’- `claude --register-agents` - Manually refresh agent registry
    62â†’- `claude --agent <name>` or `claude agent <name>` - Run specific agent
    63â†’- `claude --agent-info <name>` - Show detailed agent information
    64â†’- `claude --fix` - Auto-detect and fix issues
    65â†’- `claude --safe` - Run without permission bypass
    66â†’
    67â†’### Agent Discovery
    68â†’The wrapper automatically finds agents in:
    69â†’1. `$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/agents` (if project root detected)
    70â†’2. Script directory + `/agents` (follows symlinks)
    71â†’3. Current directory + `/agents`
    72â†’4. Fallback to `$HOME/agents`
    73â†’

   177â†’## Tandem Orchestration System
   178â†’
   179â†’The Tandem Orchestration System is an advanced Python-first orchestration layer that provides immediate functionality while maintaining seamless integration capabilities with the binary communication system.
   180â†’
   181â†’### Architecture Overview
   182â†’
   183â†’```yaml
   184â†’orchestration_layers:
   185â†’  strategic_layer:
   186â†’    language: Python
   187â†’    purpose: "High-level coordination, complex logic, library integration"
   188â†’    components:
   189â†’      - production_orchestrator.py (608 lines)
   190â†’      - agent_registry.py (461 lines)
   191â†’      - test_tandem_system.py (331 lines)
   192â†’    
   193â†’  tactical_layer:
   194â†’    language: C
   195â†’    purpose: "High-performance, low-latency operations"
   196â†’    integration: "Seamless upgrade path from Python layer"
   197â†’    performance: "4.2M msg/sec throughput capability"
   198â†’```
   199â†’
   200â†’### Execution Modes
   201â†’
   202â†’1. **INTELLIGENT** - Python orchestrates, leverages best of both layers
   203â†’2. **REDUNDANT** - Both layers execute for critical reliability  
   204â†’3. **CONSENSUS** - Both layers must agree on outcomes
   205â†’4. **SPEED_CRITICAL** - C layer only for maximum performance
   206â†’5. **PYTHON_ONLY** - Pure Python for complex logic and library access
   207â†’
   208â†’### Core Components
   209â†’
   210â†’**ProductionOrchestrator**: Main orchestration engine
   211â†’- Command set execution with dependency management
   212â†’- 5 execution modes for different requirements
   213â†’- Real-time metrics and performance monitoring
   214â†’- Mock execution for immediate functionality
   215â†’
   216â†’**AgentRegistry**: Intelligent agent discovery system  
   217â†’- Automatic discovery of all 32 agents from .md files
   218â†’- Health monitoring and capability mapping
   219â†’- Dynamic agent allocation based on availability
   220â†’- Support for both YAML frontmatter and structured content
   221â†’
   222â†’**StandardWorkflows**: Pre-built workflow templates
   223â†’- Document Generation Pipeline (TUI + DOCGEN coordination)
   224â†’- Security Audit Campaign (with redundancy)
   225â†’- Complete Development Cycle (planning to deployment)
   226â†’
   227â†’### Performance Metrics
   228â†’
   229â†’- **Test Success Rate**: 85.7% (6/7 categories) = Production Ready
   230â†’- **Agent Discovery**: 32 agents automatically registered
   231â†’- **Mock Execution**: Immediate functionality without C dependencies
   232â†’- **Real-time Monitoring**: Health scores, task counters, execution metrics
   233â†’- **Workflow Execution**: Complex multi-step processes validated
   234â†’
   235â†’### Integration Benefits
   236â†’
   237â†’- **Microcode Resilience**: Bypasses hardware restrictions through Python-first approach
   238â†’- **Immediate Functionality**: Works without C layer compilation
   239â†’- **Seamless Upgrade Path**: Automatic C integration when available
   240â†’- **Command Set Abstraction**: High-level workflow coordination beyond individual instructions
   241â†’- **Agent Coordination**: True tandem operation with binary communications
   242â†’
   243â†’### Usage Examples
   244â†’
   245â†’```python
   246â†’# Initialize orchestrator
   247â†’orchestrator = ProductionOrchestrator()
   248â†’await orchestrator.initialize()
   249â†’
   250â†’# Execute standard workflow
   251â†’workflow = StandardWorkflows.create_document_generation_workflow()
   252â†’result = await orchestrator.execute_command_set(workflow)
   253â†’
   254â†’# Direct agent invocation
   255â†’result = await orchestrator.invoke_agent("director", "create_plan", {"project": "my_app"})
   256â†’
   257â†’# Custom command set
   258â†’command_set = CommandSet(
   259â†’    name="Custom Security Audit",
   260â†’    mode=ExecutionMode.REDUNDANT,
   261â†’    steps=[
   262â†’        CommandStep(agent="security", action="vulnerability_scan"),
   263â†’        CommandStep(agent="securitychaosagent", action="chaos_test")
   264â†’    ]
   265â†’)
   266â†’result = await orchestrator.execute_command_set(command_set)
   267â†’```

   270â†’

   886â†’## Documentation Guidelines
   887â†’
   888â†’### Documentation Organization Policy ğŸ“š MANDATORY
   889â†’**ALL DOCUMENTATION MUST BE FILED IN THE docs/ FOLDER**
   890â†’- **NEVER leave documentation in the root directory**
   891â†’- **ALWAYS organize docs into appropriate subfolders**:
   892â†’  - `docs/fixes/` - Bug fixes, patches, and issue resolutions
   893â†’  - `docs/features/` - New features and enhancements
   894â†’  - `docs/guides/` - User guides, tutorials, and how-tos
   895â†’  - `docs/technical/` - Technical specifications, architecture docs
   896â†’  - `docs/` - General documentation and index files
   897â†’- **ALWAYS update docs/README.md** when adding new documentation
   898â†’- **Use descriptive filenames**: `BASH_OUTPUT_FIX_SUMMARY.md` not `fix.md`
   899â†’- **Include date in filename for time-sensitive docs**: `2025-08-25-wrapper-fix.md`
   900â†’- **Create subdirectories for major features**: `docs/features/tandem-orchestration/`
   901â†’
   902â†’### Documentation Standards
   903â†’- **Markdown format** for all documentation (.md extension)
   904â†’- **Clear headers** with proper hierarchy (# ## ###)
   905â†’- **Code examples** in fenced code blocks with language specification
   906â†’- **Status indicators**: âœ… Complete, ğŸš§ In Progress, âŒ Deprecated
   907â†’- **Version numbers** when relevant
   908â†’- **Links to related docs** at the bottom of each file
   909â†’
   910â†’## Development Guidelines
   911â†’
   912â†’### Core Development Philosophy âš ï¸ CRITICAL âš ï¸
   913â†’**PRESERVE FUNCTIONALITY OVER SIMPLIFICATION**
   914â†’- **NEVER simplify systems just to make them work**
   915â†’- **ALWAYS preserve existing functionality when integrating new features**
   916â†’- **Use adapter patterns and compatibility layers instead of removing features**
   917â†’- **If integration is complex, make it work correctly rather than making it simple**
   918â†’- **"Smart way to do this" means finding elegant solutions that preserve ALL capabilities**
   919â†’- **When conflicts arise, extend structures rather than remove fields**
   920â†’- **Include dependencies we don't need rather than accidentally removing ones we do**
   921â†’
   922â†’### Path Management Policy âš ï¸ CRITICAL âš ï¸
   923â†’**NEVER HARDCODE ABSOLUTE PATHS**
   924â†’- **ALWAYS use relative paths, environment variables, or dynamic resolution**
   925â†’- **NEVER commit hardcoded user-specific paths like /home/username/**
   926â†’- **Use `$(dirname "$0")` for script-relative paths**
   927â†’- **Use environment variables for configurable locations**
   928â†’- **Ensure portability across different systems and users**
   929â†’
   930â†’### Integration Approach
   931â†’- **Seamless Integration**: New features must work alongside existing systems
   932â†’- **Zero Functionality Loss**: Every existing feature must continue working
   933â†’- **Comprehensive Solutions**: Use "ultrathink" to plan complete integrations
   934â†’- **Adaptive Patterns**: Use adapters, wrappers, and bridges for compatibility
   935â†’- **Gradual Enhancement**: Add intelligence without breaking existing paths
   936â†’

   939â†’2. Define unique UUID and metadata

   944â†’7. Set quantifiable success metrics

   946â†’### Code Style
   947â†’- NO comments unless explicitly requested
   948â†’- Follow existing patterns in codebase
   949â†’- Check neighboring files for conventions
   950â†’- Use existing libraries (check package.json/requirements.txt)
   951â†’- Preserve all existing APIs and interfaces
   952â†’- Extend rather than replace when possible
   953â†’- **NEVER hardcode absolute paths** - use relative paths, environment variables, or dynamic resolution
   954â†’
   955â†’### Organization & Cleanliness Policy
   956â†’- **Keep directories CLEAN**: Move deprecated/duplicate files to `deprecated/` folders
   957â†’- **No duplicate files**: Use descriptive names, not `.duplicate` suffixes
   958â†’- **Clear naming**: No confusing suffixes like `_final`, `_enhanced`, `_optimized`
   959â†’- **Documented deprecation**: Update READMEs when moving files to deprecated
   960â†’- **Systematic cleanup**: Regular organization maintenance is paramount
   961â†’- **Active vs Deprecated**: Clear separation between working and legacy code

# CLAUDE.md - Project Context for Claude Code

## Project Overview

**Name**: Claude-Portable Agent Framework v7.0  
**Repository**: https://github.com/SWORDIntel/claude-backups  
**Purpose**: Hardware-aware multi-agent orchestration system with Tandem Orchestration, optimized for Intel Meteor Lake architecture  
**Status**: PRODUCTION  
**Claude Code Version**: 1.0.77 (@anthropic-ai/claude-code)  
**Latest Feature**: Claude Ultimate Wrapper v13.1 with Automatic Agent Registration  
**Database**: PostgreSQL 16/17 with pgvector extension, enhanced JSON, VACUUM improvements, and ML learning capabilities  
**Agent Count**: 71 specialized agents detected in agents/ directory (includes documentation and templates)  
**Wrapper Version**: claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh v13.1 (symlinked installation)

## System Architecture

This is a comprehensive agent-based system with **71 agent files in the agents/ directory** (69 specialized agents plus templates/docs) that can autonomously coordinate via Claude Code's Task tool and the advanced Tandem Orchestration System. All agents follow the v7.0 template standard and are optimized for Intel Meteor Lake CPUs with dual-layer Python/C execution capabilities.

### Key Features
- **Hardware-Aware Execution**: Optimized for Intel Core Ultra 7 155H (Meteor Lake)
- **Autonomous Coordination**: Agents invoke each other via Task tool
- **Proactive Invocation**: Pattern-based auto-triggering
- **Production Ready**: Comprehensive error handling and recovery
- **PostgreSQL 16/17 Universal Database**: >2000 auth/sec, <25ms P95 latency, backwards compatible JSON operations
- **Enhanced Learning System v3.1**: ML-powered agent performance analytics with schema evolution and drift prevention
- **Tandem Orchestration**: Advanced Python-first orchestration system with C integration capability
- **Dual-Layer Architecture**: Strategic Python layer + tactical C layer for maximum flexibility
- **Command Sets**: High-level workflow abstraction for complex multi-agent coordination
- **Global CLAUDE.md**: Comprehensive auto-invocation guide with 15k+ words of agent patterns
- **Professional Organization**: Clean directory structure with database/, agents/, docs/, orchestration/
- **Counter-Intelligence Integration**: 99.99% surveillance evasion with Five Eyes/NATO defense capabilities
- **Cognitive Defense**: 99.94% manipulation detection with deprogramming protocols
- **Claude Ultimate Wrapper v13.1**: Automatic agent discovery and registration with enhanced error recovery

## Claude Ultimate Wrapper v13.1

The `claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh` is an enhanced wrapper that provides:

### Features
- **Automatic Agent Registration**: Discovers and registers all 71 agents from `agents/` directory
- **Intelligent Path Discovery**: Finds agents relative to script location (symlink-aware)
- **Agent Metadata Extraction**: Extracts category, description, UUID, tools from agent files
- **Status Classification**: Categorizes agents as active/template/stub based on completeness
- **JSON Registry Cache**: Maintains cached registry for performance
- **Error Recovery**: Automatic yoga.wasm issue detection and recovery
- **Virtual Environment Support**: Automatic venv activation if available
- **Permission Bypass**: Built-in `--dangerously-skip-permissions` for LiveCD compatibility
- **Banner Suppression**: Clean output without verbose headers

### Installation
```bash
# Symlink installation (preserves agent discovery)
ln -sf /home/ubuntu/Downloads/claude-backups/claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh /home/ubuntu/.local/bin/claude
chmod +x /home/ubuntu/Downloads/claude-backups/claude-wrapper-ultimate.sh
```

### Commands
- `claude --help` - Show comprehensive help
- `claude --status` - System status with agent registry info
- `claude --agents` or `claude agents` - List all available agents by category
- `claude --register-agents` - Manually refresh agent registry
- `claude --agent <name>` or `claude agent <name>` - Run specific agent
- `claude --agent-info <name>` - Show detailed agent information
- `claude --fix` - Auto-detect and fix issues
- `claude --safe` - Run without permission bypass

### Agent Discovery
The wrapper automatically finds agents in:
1. `$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/agents` (if project root detected)
2. Script directory + `/agents` (follows symlinks)
3. Current directory + `/agents`
4. Fallback to `$HOME/agents`

## Agent Ecosystem (71 Files, 69 Active Agents)

### Command & Control (2 agents)
- **Director**: Strategic command and control (CRITICAL)
- **ProjectOrchestrator**: Tactical coordination nexus (CRITICAL)

### Security Specialists (13 agents)
- **Security**: Comprehensive security analysis
- **Bastion**: Defensive security specialist
- **SecurityChaosAgent**: Distributed chaos testing
- **SecurityAuditor**: Advanced security audits
- **CSO**: Chief Security Officer coordination
- **CryptoExpert**: Cryptography and encryption
- **QuantumGuard**: Quantum security protocols
- **RedTeamOrchestrator**: Red team operations
- **APT41Defense**: Advanced persistent threat defense
- **NSA_TTP**: Nation-state tactics and techniques
- **PsyOps**: Psychological operations defense
- **Ghost-Protocol**: Elite counter-intelligence & anti-surveillance (99.99% evasion)
- **Cognitive-Defense**: Cognitive warfare defense & manipulation detection (99.94% accuracy)

### Core Development (8 agents)
- **Architect**: System design and technical architecture
- **Constructor**: Project initialization specialist
- **Patcher**: Precision code surgery and bug fixes
- **Debugger**: Tactical failure analysis
- **Testbed**: Elite test engineering
- **Linter**: Senior code review specialist

### Infrastructure & DevOps (6 agents)

- **Deployer**: Deployment orchestration
- **Monitor**: Observability and monitoring
- **Packager**: Package management and distribution
- **Docker**: Container orchestration

### Language-Specific Development (8 agents)
- **C-Internal**: Elite C/C++ systems engineer
- **Python-Internal**: Python execution environment
- **Rust-Internal**: Rust systems programming
- **Go-Internal**: Go backend development
- **Java-Internal**: Java enterprise applications
- **TypeScript-Internal**: TypeScript/JavaScript development
- **Kotlin-Internal**: Kotlin multiplatform development

### Specialized Platforms (7 agents)
- **APIDesigner**: API architecture and contracts
- **Database**: Data architecture and optimization
- **Web**: Modern web frameworks (React/Vue/Angular)
- **Mobile**: iOS/Android development
- **AndroidMobile**: Android-specific development

### Data & ML (4 agents)
- **DataScience**: Data analysis and ML specialist

- **SQL-Internal**: Elite SQL specialist (100K+ QPS capability)

### Network & Systems (4 agents)

- **DD-WRT**: Router firmware management

### Hardware & Acceleration (2 agents)
- **GNA**: Gaussian Neural Accelerator
- **LeadEngineer**: Hardware-software integration

### Planning & Documentation (4 agents)
- **Planner**: Strategic project planning
- **Docgen**: Documentation engineering
- **Researcher**: Technology evaluation
- **StatusLine-Integration**: Development environment integration

### Quality & Oversight (2 agents)
- **Oversight**: Quality assurance and compliance
- **Integration**: System integration specialist

### Additional Agents Found in agents/ Directory
The following additional agents were detected (71 total files):
- **APT41-Defense-Agent**: APT41 defense specialist
- **APT41-RedTeam-Agent**: APT41 red team simulator
- **BGP-Blue-Team**: BGP blue team operations
- **BGP-Red-Team**: BGP red team operations
- **Carbon-Internal-Agent**: Carbon analysis specialist
- **ClaudeCode-PromptInjector**: Prompt injection testing
- **CPP-Internal-Agent**: C++ development specialist
- **Ghost-Protocol-Agent**: Counter-intelligence operations
- **Prompt-Defender**: Prompt defense mechanisms
- **Prompt-Injector**: Prompt injection testing
- **PsyOps-Agent**: Psychological operations
- **Wrapper-Liberation**: Wrapper liberation tools
- **Wrapper-Liberation-Pro**: Advanced wrapper liberation
- **Zig-Internal-Agent**: Zig language specialist
- **Template.md**: Agent template for new agents
- **WHERE_I_AM.md**: Documentation file

## Tandem Orchestration System

The Tandem Orchestration System is an advanced Python-first orchestration layer that provides immediate functionality while maintaining seamless integration capabilities with the binary communication system.

### Architecture Overview

```yaml
orchestration_layers:
  strategic_layer:
    language: Python
    purpose: "High-level coordination, complex logic, library integration"
    components:
      - production_orchestrator.py (608 lines)
      - agent_registry.py (461 lines)
      - test_tandem_system.py (331 lines)
    
  tactical_layer:
    language: C
    purpose: "High-performance, low-latency operations"
    integration: "Seamless upgrade path from Python layer"
    performance: "4.2M msg/sec throughput capability"
```

### Execution Modes

1. **INTELLIGENT** - Python orchestrates, leverages best of both layers
2. **REDUNDANT** - Both layers execute for critical reliability  
3. **CONSENSUS** - Both layers must agree on outcomes
4. **SPEED_CRITICAL** - C layer only for maximum performance
5. **PYTHON_ONLY** - Pure Python for complex logic and library access

### Core Components

**ProductionOrchestrator**: Main orchestration engine
- Command set execution with dependency management
- 5 execution modes for different requirements
- Real-time metrics and performance monitoring
- Mock execution for immediate functionality

**AgentRegistry**: Intelligent agent discovery system  
- Automatic discovery of all 32 agents from .md files
- Health monitoring and capability mapping
- Dynamic agent allocation based on availability
- Support for both YAML frontmatter and structured content

**StandardWorkflows**: Pre-built workflow templates
- Document Generation Pipeline (TUI + DOCGEN coordination)
- Security Audit Campaign (with redundancy)
- Complete Development Cycle (planning to deployment)

### Performance Metrics

- **Test Success Rate**: 85.7% (6/7 categories) = Production Ready
- **Agent Discovery**: 32 agents automatically registered
- **Mock Execution**: Immediate functionality without C dependencies
- **Real-time Monitoring**: Health scores, task counters, execution metrics
- **Workflow Execution**: Complex multi-step processes validated

### Integration Benefits

- **Microcode Resilience**: Bypasses hardware restrictions through Python-first approach
- **Immediate Functionality**: Works without C layer compilation
- **Seamless Upgrade Path**: Automatic C integration when available
- **Command Set Abstraction**: High-level workflow coordination beyond individual instructions
- **Agent Coordination**: True tandem operation with binary communications

### Usage Examples

```python
# Initialize orchestrator
orchestrator = ProductionOrchestrator()
await orchestrator.initialize()

# Execute standard workflow
workflow = StandardWorkflows.create_document_generation_workflow()
result = await orchestrator.execute_command_set(workflow)

# Direct agent invocation
result = await orchestrator.invoke_agent("director", "create_plan", {"project": "my_app"})

# Custom command set
command_set = CommandSet(
    name="Custom Security Audit",
    mode=ExecutionMode.REDUNDANT,
    steps=[
        CommandStep(agent="security", action="vulnerability_scan"),
        CommandStep(agent="securitychaosagent", action="chaos_test")
    ]
)
result = await orchestrator.execute_command_set(command_set)
```

### Testing and Validation

**Direct Python Testing**:
```bash
# Run comprehensive tests
python3 agents/src/python/test_tandem_system.py --comprehensive

# Quick demonstration
python3 agents/src/python/test_tandem_system.py --demo

# Default: both demo and comprehensive tests
python3 agents/src/python/test_tandem_system.py
```

**Integrated System Testing via switch.sh**:
```bash
# Switch to .md mode with Python orchestration
cd agents
CLAUDE_AGENTS_ROOT=$(pwd) ./switch.sh md

# Interactive menu with Python test option
CLAUDE_AGENTS_ROOT=$(pwd) ./switch.sh menu
# Select option [4] to test Python Tandem Orchestration

# Check system status (shows Python orchestration state)
CLAUDE_AGENTS_ROOT=$(pwd) ./switch.sh status
```

### Current System Status

**Production Ready Components**:
- âœ… **Python Tandem Orchestration**: 85.7% test success rate, 35 agents discovered
- âœ… **Agent Registry**: Automatic discovery from .md files with health monitoring
- âœ… **Standard Workflows**: Document generation, security audit, development cycle
- âœ… **Switch.sh Integration**: Python orchestration active in both binary and .md modes

**Hardware-Restricted Components**:
- âš ï¸ **Binary Communication System**: Fails due to microcode restrictions (Intel ME interference)
- ğŸ”„ **C Layer Integration**: Ready for upgrade when hardware restrictions resolved
- âœ… **Database System**: PostgreSQL 17 fully operational and binary-integration ready

**Operational Mode**:
Currently operating in **Python-first mode** with seamless C integration capability when hardware allows. The PostgreSQL 17 enhanced database system provides 2x authentication performance (>2000 auth/sec) and is 100% ready for binary system integration when AVX restrictions are resolved. All database structures, performance optimizations, and monitoring systems are designed for immediate binary integration with zero downtime.

### Integration Methods

The system offers multiple integration approaches to match different user preferences:

**1. Unified Orchestration (RECOMMENDED - NEW)**:
- `claude-unified` - Complete integration of permission bypass + orchestration
- Automatic `--dangerously-skip-permissions` for LiveCD compatibility
- Intelligent multi-agent workflow detection and routing
- Zero learning curve - works as drop-in replacement for `claude`
- Environment controls: `CLAUDE_PERMISSION_BYPASS=false`, `CLAUDE_ORCHESTRATION=false`

**2. Seamless Integration (Legacy)**:
- `claude-enhanced` - Drop-in replacement for `claude` command
- Automatic detection of multi-step workflows with gentle suggestions
- Zero learning curve - existing commands work exactly the same
- Intelligent pattern recognition for orchestration opportunities

**3. Direct Orchestration**:
- `claude-orchestrate` - Direct access to orchestration capabilities
- Natural language task analysis and workflow suggestions
- Best for known complex tasks requiring coordination

**4. Standalone Launcher**:
- `python-orchestrator-launcher.sh` - Comprehensive interactive interface
- Full system control with status monitoring and testing
- Temporary activation with proper lifecycle management

**5. Advanced Integration**:
- Direct Python API access for custom integrations
- Switch.sh integration for system mode management
- Environment controls for selective enhancement

```yaml
  features:
    - AVX-512 support on P-cores
    - NPU for AI acceleration
    - Thermal range: 85-95Â°C normal
```

## Documentation Guidelines

### Documentation Organization Policy ğŸ“š MANDATORY
**ALL DOCUMENTATION MUST BE FILED IN THE docs/ FOLDER**
- **NEVER leave documentation in the root directory**
- **ALWAYS organize docs into appropriate subfolders**:
  - `docs/fixes/` - Bug fixes, patches, and issue resolutions
  - `docs/features/` - New features and enhancements
  - `docs/guides/` - User guides, tutorials, and how-tos
  - `docs/technical/` - Technical specifications, architecture docs
  - `docs/` - General documentation and index files
- **ALWAYS update docs/README.md** when adding new documentation
- **Use descriptive filenames**: `BASH_OUTPUT_FIX_SUMMARY.md` not `fix.md`
- **Include date in filename for time-sensitive docs**: `2025-08-25-wrapper-fix.md`
- **Create subdirectories for major features**: `docs/features/tandem-orchestration/`

### Documentation Standards
- **Markdown format** for all documentation (.md extension)
- **Clear headers** with proper hierarchy (# ## ###)
- **Code examples** in fenced code blocks with language specification
- **Status indicators**: âœ… Complete, ğŸš§ In Progress, âŒ Deprecated
- **Version numbers** when relevant
- **Links to related docs** at the bottom of each file

## Development Guidelines

### Core Development Philosophy âš ï¸ CRITICAL âš ï¸
**PRESERVE FUNCTIONALITY OVER SIMPLIFICATION**
- **NEVER simplify systems just to make them work**
- **ALWAYS preserve existing functionality when integrating new features**
- **Use adapter patterns and compatibility layers instead of removing features**
- **If integration is complex, make it work correctly rather than making it simple**
- **"Smart way to do this" means finding elegant solutions that preserve ALL capabilities**
- **When conflicts arise, extend structures rather than remove fields**
- **Include dependencies we don't need rather than accidentally removing ones we do**

### Path Management Policy âš ï¸ CRITICAL âš ï¸
**NEVER HARDCODE ABSOLUTE PATHS**
- **ALWAYS use relative paths, environment variables, or dynamic resolution**
- **NEVER commit hardcoded user-specific paths like /home/username/**
- **Use `$(dirname "$0")` for script-relative paths**
- **Use environment variables for configurable locations**
- **Ensure portability across different systems and users**

### Integration Approach
- **Seamless Integration**: New features must work alongside existing systems
- **Zero Functionality Loss**: Every existing feature must continue working
- **Comprehensive Solutions**: Use "ultrathink" to plan complete integrations
- **Adaptive Patterns**: Use adapters, wrappers, and bridges for compatibility
- **Gradual Enhancement**: Add intelligence without breaking existing paths

### Creating New Agents
1. Start with `agents/Template.md`
2. Define unique UUID and metadata
3. Include Task tool in tools list
4. Define proactive_triggers
5. Specify invokes_agents patterns
6. Implement hardware optimization
7. Set quantifiable success metrics

### Code Style
- NO comments unless explicitly requested
- Follow existing patterns in codebase
- Check neighboring files for conventions
- Use existing libraries (check package.json/requirements.txt)
- Preserve all existing APIs and interfaces
- Extend rather than replace when possible
- **NEVER hardcode absolute paths** - use relative paths, environment variables, or dynamic resolution

### Organization & Cleanliness Policy
- **Keep directories CLEAN**: Move deprecated/duplicate files to `deprecated/` folders
- **No duplicate files**: Use descriptive names, not `.duplicate` suffixes
- **Clear naming**: No confusing suffixes like `_final`, `_enhanced`, `_optimized`
- **Documented deprecation**: Update READMEs when moving files to deprecated
- **Systematic cleanup**: Regular organization maintenance is paramount
- **Active vs Deprecated**: Clear separation between working and legacy code

### Testing Requirements
- Achieve >85% code coverage
- All agents must have success metrics
- Validate hardware optimization paths
- Test agent coordination patterns

    33â†’    export CLAUDE_QUIET_MODE=true
    34â†’    export CLAUDE_SUPPRESS_BANNER=true
    35â†’    export NO_AGENT_BRIDGE_HEADER=true
    36â†’    export CLAUDE_BRIDGE_QUIET=true
    37â†’    export DISABLE_AGENT_BRIDGE=true
    38â†’else
    39â†’    # Default: Allow normal output
    40â†’    export CLAUDE_QUIET_MODE=false
    41â†’    export CLAUDE_SUPPRESS_BANNER=false
    42â†’    # Still suppress verbose headers but allow actual output
    43â†’    export NO_AGENT_BRIDGE_HEADER=true
    44â†’    export CLAUDE_BRIDGE_QUIET=false
    45â†’    export DISABLE_AGENT_BRIDGE=false
    46â†’fi
    47â†’
    48â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
    49â†’# COLORS AND SYMBOLS (SAFE)
    50â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
    51â†’
    52â†’# Check if terminal supports colors
    53â†’if [[ -t 1 ]] && [[ "$(tput colors 2>/dev/null || echo 0)" -ge 8 ]]; then
    54â†’    readonly GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    55â†’    readonly YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    56â†’    readonly CYAN='\033[0;36m'
    57â†’    readonly MAGENTA='\033[0;35m'
    58â†’    readonly RED='\033[0;31m'
    59â†’    readonly BOLD='\033[1m'
    60â†’    readonly DIM='\033[2m'
    61â†’    readonly NC='\033[0m'
    62â†’else
    63â†’    readonly GREEN='' YELLOW='' CYAN='' MAGENTA='' RED='' BOLD='' DIM='' NC=''
    64â†’fi
    65â†’
    66â†’# Status symbols
    67â†’readonly SUCCESS="âœ“"
    68â†’readonly ERROR="âœ—"
    69â†’readonly WARNING="âš "
    70â†’readonly INFO="â„¹"
    71â†’readonly FIXING="ğŸ”§"

    73â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
    74â†’# DEBUG AND LOGGING
    75â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
    76â†’
    77â†’# Enable debug mode if requested
    78â†’DEBUG_MODE="${CLAUDE_DEBUG:-false}"
    79â†’if [[ "$1" == "--debug" ]]; then
    80â†’    DEBUG_MODE="true"
    81â†’    shift
    82â†’    set -x
    83â†’fi
    84â†’
    85â†’# Logging function
    86â†’log_debug() {
    87â†’    [[ "$DEBUG_MODE" == "true" ]] && echo -e "${DIM}[DEBUG] $1${NC}" >&2
    88â†’}
    89â†’
    90â†’log_error() {
    91â†’    echo -e "${RED}${ERROR} $1${NC}" >&2
    92â†’}
    93â†’
    94â†’log_success() {

    96â†’}
    97â†’
    98â†’log_warning() {
    99â†’    echo -e "${YELLOW}${WARNING} $1${NC}" >&2
   100â†’}
   101â†’
   102â†’log_info() {
   103â†’    echo -e "${CYAN}${INFO} $1${NC}" >&2
   104â†’}
   105â†’
   106â†’log_fixing() {
   107â†’    echo -e "${MAGENTA}${FIXING} $1${NC}" >&2
   108â†’}
   109â†’
   110â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   111â†’# DEPENDENCY CHECKING AND AUTO-FIXING
   112â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   113â†’
   114â†’# Function to check if command exists
   115â†’command_exists() {
   116â†’    command -v "$1" >/dev/null 2>&1
   117â†’}
   118â†’
   119â†’# Function to check Node.js and npm
   120â†’check_node_npm() {
   121â†’    local has_issues=false
   122â†’    
   123â†’    if ! command_exists node; then
   124â†’        log_error "Node.js is not installed"
   125â†’        has_issues=true
   126â†’    else
   127â†’        local node_version=$(node --version 2>/dev/null | sed 's/v//')
   128â†’        log_debug "Node.js version: $node_version"
   129â†’        
   130â†’        # Check if version is sufficient (>= 14.0.0)
   131â†’        local major_version=$(echo "$node_version" | cut -d. -f1)
   132â†’        if [[ "$major_version" -lt 14 ]]; then
   133â†’            log_warning "Node.js version is old ($node_version). Consider upgrading to 14+"
   134â†’        fi
   135â†’    fi
   136â†’    
   137â†’    if ! command_exists npm; then
   138â†’        log_error "npm is not installed"
   139â†’        has_issues=true
   140â†’    else
   141â†’        log_debug "npm version: $(npm --version 2>/dev/null)"
   142â†’    fi
   143â†’    
   144â†’    return $([ "$has_issues" = true ] && echo 1 || echo 0)
   145â†’}
   146â†’
   147â†’# Function to verify Claude installation health
   148â†’verify_claude_health() {
   149â†’    local claude_path="$1"
   150â†’    
   151â†’    if [[ ! -f "$claude_path" ]]; then
   152â†’        return 1
   153â†’    fi
   154â†’    
   155â†’    # Check if yoga.wasm issue exists by attempting a dry run
   156â†’    local test_output=$(node "$claude_path" --version 2>&1)
   157â†’    local exit_code=$?
   158â†’    
   159â†’    if [[ $exit_code -ne 0 ]]; then
   160â†’        if echo "$test_output" | grep -q "yoga.wasm"; then
   161â†’            log_warning "Detected yoga.wasm issue"
   162â†’            return 2  # Special code for yoga.wasm issue
   163â†’        elif echo "$test_output" | grep -q "Cannot find module"; then
   164â†’            log_warning "Missing module detected"
   165â†’            return 3  # Missing modules
   166â†’        else
   167â†’            log_debug "Unknown error: $test_output"
   168â†’            return 1  # General error
   169â†’        fi
   170â†’    fi
   171â†’    
   172â†’    log_debug "Claude health check passed"
   173â†’    return 0
   174â†’}
   175â†’
   176â†’# Function to fix yoga.wasm issue
   177â†’fix_yoga_wasm_issue() {
   178â†’    log_fixing "Attempting to fix yoga.wasm issue..."
   179â†’    
   180â†’    # Method 1: Set environment variable to bypass yoga
   181â†’    export CLAUDE_NO_YOGA=1
   182â†’    export NODE_OPTIONS="--no-warnings"
   183â†’    
   184â†’    # Method 2: Try reinstalling if user confirms
   185â†’    if [[ "${CLAUDE_AUTO_FIX:-false}" == "true" ]]; then
   186â†’        log_info "Auto-fix enabled. Reinstalling Claude Code..."
   187â†’        
   188â†’        # Save current directory
   189â†’        local current_dir=$(pwd)
   190â†’        
   191â†’        # Uninstall and reinstall
   192â†’        npm uninstall -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code >/dev/null 2>&1
   193â†’        npm cache clean --force >/dev/null 2>&1
   194â†’        npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code --force >/dev/null 2>&1
   195â†’        
   196â†’        # Return to original directory
   197â†’        cd "$current_dir"
   198â†’        
   199â†’        if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
   200â†’            log_success "Claude Code reinstalled successfully"
   201â†’            return 0
   202â†’        else
   203â†’            log_warning "Reinstall failed, using workaround mode"
   204â†’        fi
   205â†’    fi
   206â†’    
   207â†’    # Method 3: Create yoga.wasm placeholder if needed
   208â†’    local claude_dir=""
   209â†’    for dir in \
   210â†’        "$HOME/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/@anthropic-ai/claude-code" \
   211â†’        "/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@anthropic-ai/claude-code" \
   212â†’        "$(npm root -g)/@anthropic-ai/claude-code"; do
   213â†’        if [[ -d "$dir" ]]; then
   214â†’            claude_dir="$dir"
   215â†’            break
   216â†’        fi
   217â†’    done
   218â†’    
   219â†’    if [[ -n "$claude_dir" ]] && [[ ! -f "$claude_dir/yoga.wasm" ]]; then
   220â†’        echo "// Placeholder" > "$claude_dir/yoga.wasm" 2>/dev/null || true
   221â†’        log_debug "Created yoga.wasm placeholder"
   222â†’    fi
   223â†’    
   224â†’    return 0
   225â†’}
   226â†’
   227â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   228â†’# VIRTUAL ENVIRONMENT ACTIVATION
   229â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   230â†’
   231â†’activate_venv() {
   232â†’    local venv_paths=(
   233â†’        "${CLAUDE_VENV:-}"
   234â†’        "./venv"
   235â†’        "./.venv"
   236â†’        "../venv"
   237â†’        "../.venv"
   238â†’    )
   239â†’    
   240â†’    for venv_path in "${venv_paths[@]}"; do
   241â†’        if [[ -n "$venv_path" ]] && [[ -d "$venv_path" ]] && [[ -f "$venv_path/bin/activate" ]]; then
   242â†’            log_debug "Activating virtual environment: $venv_path"
   243â†’            
   244â†’            # Use realpath to get absolute path for exports
   245â†’            local abs_venv_path="$(realpath "$venv_path" 2>/dev/null || echo "$venv_path")"
   246â†’            
   247â†’            export VIRTUAL_ENV="$abs_venv_path"
   248â†’            export PATH="$abs_venv_path/bin:$PATH"
   249â†’            export PYTHONPATH="$abs_venv_path/lib/python*/site-packages:${PYTHONPATH:-}"
   250â†’            unset PYTHONHOME
   251â†’            
   252â†’            export CLAUDE_VENV_ACTIVATED="true"
   253â†’            export CLAUDE_VENV_PATH="$abs_venv_path"
   254â†’            
   255â†’            return 0
   256â†’        fi
   257â†’    done
   258â†’    
   259â†’    export CLAUDE_VENV_ACTIVATED="false"
   260â†’    return 1
   261â†’}
   262â†’
   263â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   264â†’# INTELLIGENT PATH DISCOVERY
   265â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   266â†’
   267â†’find_project_root() {
   268â†’    local current_dir="$(pwd 2>/dev/null || echo "$HOME")"
   269â†’    
   270â†’    # First check if script is being run from within a project directory
   271â†’    local script_dir="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd 2>/dev/null)"
   272â†’    
   273â†’    local search_paths=(
   274â†’        "$current_dir"
   275â†’        "$script_dir"
   276â†’        "${CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT:-}"
   277â†’        "$HOME/Documents/Claude"
   278â†’        "$HOME/Documents/claude-backups"
   279â†’        "$HOME/claude-backups"
   280â†’        "$HOME/projects/claude"
   281â†’        "$HOME/workspace/claude"
   282â†’    )
   283â†’    
   284â†’    for path in "${search_paths[@]}"; do
   285â†’        if [[ -n "$path" ]] && [[ -d "$path" ]]; then
   286â†’            if [[ -d "$path/agents" ]] || [[ -f "$path/CLAUDE.md" ]] || [[ -d "$path/.claude" ]]; then
   287â†’                echo "$path"
   288â†’                return 0
   289â†’            fi
   290â†’        fi
   291â†’    done
   292â†’    
   293â†’    # If no project found, use current directory if it has agents
   294â†’    if [[ -d "$current_dir/agents" ]]; then
   295â†’        echo "$current_dir"
   296â†’        return 0
   297â†’    fi
   298â†’    
   299â†’    echo "$HOME/claude-project"
   300â†’    mkdir -p "$HOME/claude-project" 2>/dev/null || true
   301â†’}
   302â†’
   303â†’find_claude_binary() {
   304â†’    local search_paths=(
   305â†’        # Check npm global installations
   306â†’        "$(npm root -g 2>/dev/null)/@anthropic-ai/claude-code/cli.js"
   307â†’        "$HOME/.npm-global/lib/node_modules/@anthropic-ai/claude-code/cli.js"
   308â†’        "$HOME/.npm-global/bin/claude"
   309â†’        "/usr/local/lib/node_modules/@anthropic-ai/claude-code/cli.js"
   310â†’        "/usr/local/bin/claude"
   311â†’        
   312â†’        # Check PATH
   313â†’        "$(which claude 2>/dev/null || true)"
   314â†’        "$(which claude-code 2>/dev/null || true)"
   315â†’    )
   316â†’    
   317â†’    # Also check npm bin if npm exists
   318â†’    if command_exists npm; then
   319â†’        local npm_bin=$(npm bin -g 2>/dev/null)
   320â†’        if [[ -n "$npm_bin" ]]; then
   321â†’            search_paths+=("$npm_bin/claude")
   322â†’            search_paths+=("$npm_bin/claude-code")
   323â†’        fi
   324â†’    fi
   325â†’    
   326â†’    for path in "${search_paths[@]}"; do
   327â†’        if [[ -n "$path" ]] && [[ -f "$path" ]]; then
   328â†’            log_debug "Found Claude binary: $path"
   329â†’            echo "$path"
   330â†’            return 0
   331â†’        fi
   332â†’    done
   333â†’    
   334â†’    return 1
   335â†’}
   336â†’
   337â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   338â†’# SMART EXECUTION WITH FALLBACKS
   339â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   340â†’
   341â†’execute_claude() {
   342â†’    local claude_binary="$1"
   343â†’    shift
   344â†’    local args=("$@")
   345â†’    
   346â†’    # Add permission bypass if enabled (default to true)
   347â†’    if [[ "${PERMISSION_BYPASS:-true}" == "true" ]] && [[ "${args[0]}" != "--safe" ]]; then
   348â†’        args=("--dangerously-skip-permissions" "${args[@]}")
   349â†’    fi
   350â†’    
   351â†’    # Remove --safe flag if present
   352â†’    if [[ "${args[0]}" == "--safe" ]]; then
   353â†’        args=("${args[@]:1}")
   354â†’        PERMISSION_BYPASS="false"
   355â†’    fi
   356â†’    
   357â†’    log_debug "Executing: $claude_binary ${args[*]}"
   358â†’    
   359â†’    # FIXED: Don't use exec which replaces the shell process
   360â†’    # Instead, run normally to preserve output handling
   361â†’    
   362â†’    # Method 1: Try direct execution
   363â†’    if [[ -x "$claude_binary" ]]; then
   364â†’        "$claude_binary" "${args[@]}"
   365â†’        return $?
   366â†’    fi
   367â†’    
   368â†’    # Method 2: Try with node
   369â†’    if command_exists node; then
   370â†’        node "$claude_binary" "${args[@]}"
   371â†’        return $?
   372â†’    fi
   373â†’    
   374â†’    # Method 3: Try with npx
   375â†’    if command_exists npx; then
   376â†’        npx @anthropic-ai/claude-code "${args[@]}"
   377â†’        return $?
   378â†’    fi
   379â†’    
   380â†’    log_error "All execution methods failed"
   381â†’    return 1
   382â†’}
   383â†’
   384â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   385â†’# CONFIGURATION AND INITIALIZATION
   386â†’# â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”â”
   387â†’
   388â†’initialize_environment() {
   389â†’    # Activate virtual environment if available
   390â†’    activate_venv
   391â†’    
   392â†’    # Set up environment variables
   393â†’    export CLAUDE_HOME="${CLAUDE_HOME:-$HOME/.claude-home}"
   394â†’    export CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT="${CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT:-$(find_project_root)}"
   395â†’    
   396â†’    # Setup directories
   397â†’    if [[ -d "$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/.claude" ]]; then
   398â†’        export CLAUDE_DIR="$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/.claude"
   399â†’        export CLAUDE_AGENTS_DIR="$CLAUDE_DIR/agents"
   400â†’        export CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR="$CLAUDE_DIR/config"
   401â†’    elif [[ -d "$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/agents" ]]; then
   402â†’        # If agents directory exists in project root, use it
   403â†’        export CLAUDE_AGENTS_DIR="$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/agents"
   404â†’        export CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR="$CLAUDE_PROJECT_ROOT/config"
   405â†’    elif [[ -d "./agents" ]]; then
   406â†’        # If agents directory exists relative to current directory
   407â†’        export CLAUDE_AGENTS_DIR="$(realpath ./agents 2>/dev/null || pwd)/agents"
   408â†’        export CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR="$(realpath ./config 2>/dev/null || pwd)/config"
   409â†’    else
   410â†’        # Final fallback
   411â†’        export CLAUDE_AGENTS_DIR="${CLAUDE_AGENTS_DIR:-$HOME/agents}"
   412â†’        export CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR="${CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR:-$HOME/.config/claude}"
   413â†’    fi
   414â†’    
   415â†’    # Cache directory
   416â†’    export CACHE_DIR="${CLAUDE_CACHE_DIR:-$HOME/.cache/claude}"
   417â†’    mkdir -p "$CACHE_DIR" 2>/dev/null || export CACHE_DIR="/tmp/claude-cache-$$"
   418â†’    
   419â†’    # Feature flags
   420â†’    export PERMISSION_BYPASS="${CLAUDE_PERMISSION_BYPASS:-true}"
   421â†’    export AUTO_FIX="${CLAUDE_AUTO_FIX:-true}"
   422â†’    export ORCHESTRATION_ENABLED="${CLAUDE_ORCHESTRATION:-true}"
   423â†’    export LEARNING_MODE="${CLAUDE_LEARNING:-true}"
   424â†’    
   425â†’    # Set Node options for better compatibility
   426â†’    export NODE_OPTIONS="${NODE_OPTIONS:---no-warnings}"
   427â†’    export CLAUDE_NO_YOGA="${CLAUDE_NO_YOGA:-1}"
   428â†’    
   429â†’    log_debug "Environment initialized"
   430â†’}
